column5: 91 days till Forrest Lodge and Caribou Lake! Party of three this year (21 year old daughter coming along).

In 99 days by this time we will be crossing into Wisconsin on our way to Lac Seul. Cross the border Friday night at I Falls, a night of restless sleeping at the Rainbow, knowing fresh walleye and Canadian air filled with the scent of pine and the cry of the loon will greet us each day at Goose Bay Camp.
98 days to go now, with the "spring forward" we have one less hour to wait, before we hit the waters of Lac Seul!
82 Went to the sports show last night sat thru a seminar by Gary Parsons about pitching jigs now the fever got worse..... all those Canadian outfitters with those pictures and what not ugh!
80 days and we will be heading up to Westwood Lodge on Big Island Lake Flin Flon, MB.

Hey man..youre going up for June 9th? we are going for the 16th this year for the Muskie opener..but 4 of us are going in 3 days early and are going to try our hand for lake trout on Cliff Lake on the 14th..
First trip 90 days and a wake up, second trip 118. Ice in MN is too solid to boat and too soft to walk, so it's all about the wait now...

With the above average temps here in Cen Il, I am reminded of the early June weather in Ontario! 93 more days until we load up the suv and head North! The warm breeze with a hint of coolness in the air, the blue skies, with wisps of clouds drifting by invites me to recall the gentle rocking of the Lund Oufitter while jigging for lunch on Lac Seul!
Anybody else a member of the 100 Day Club? Of course by this time Friday it will be the 99 day club!Goose Bay Camp NW section of Lac Seul awaits!
93 days until we arrive for a week on Wabaskang!
93 days until we arrive at Black Bay outpost..Lac Seul
84 days and counting till we hit Evergreen Lodge on Lac Suel

We were planning to fly to Little Vermilion Lake, just north of Red Lake, Ontario, on May 19 for the walleye opener. This will be my 28th consecutive opener on the same water. I intend to keep at it until I get the hang of it.Just got off the phone with one of my long time fishing partners and we think it's a good idea to go in May 12, fish pike for a week, and then have the rest of our party join us for a week of fishing the walleye opener which begins May 19.

T- 70 days or so. Going to be hitting the water May 19th the opener. It will complete the cyle for my father and I. We will have fished the WI, and MI opener before landing in Canada. Life can be rough at times, but I'm learning to deal with it.
74 days and counting backwards Have a great year!!!!!Thank you,Larry Mac
Im also "there" year round, cant wait for open water, well until hard water season is over at least
